intro: Leptorhabdos linifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features slender, erect stems that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, arranged in a basal rosette, and are typically covered in a waxy coating. Leptorhabdos linifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodland habitats.
